title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Analysis: Will the government hike indirect cost payments in return for greater accountability?
items.description: Under new plan, universities would detail the full cost of research

items.title: New study blames diet, not physical inactivity, for obesity crisis
items.description: But some scientists warn the research, which compared energy burned across populations, can’t reveal the epidemic’s causes

items.title: Countries to budget more for HIV/AIDS measures as U.S. withdraws aid
items.description: South Africa plans modest spending increase, but shortfalls will limit prevention and treatment

items.title: Exclusive: NIH suspends dozens of pathogen studies over ‘gain-of-function’ concerns
items.description: Trump executive order leads to pauses on U.S.-funded research into TB, influenza, COVID-19, and other diseases, dismaying some scientists

items.title: Mysterious pre-Islamic script from Oman finally deciphered
items.description: Cracking the main subtype of the Dhofari script could reveal “an entirely new page of the history of Arabia”

items.title: Senate panel rejects Trump’s proposed cuts to agricultural research
items.description: House spending committee has taken similar position on 2026 request

items.title: China tops the world in artificial intelligence publications, database analysis reveals
items.description: The country also leads in patent filings and the number of AI researchers

items.title: Effort to revive New Zealand’s extinct moa stirs controversy
items.description: Suggestions that nation’s Indigenous Māori wholeheartedly back project draws criticism

items.title: Astronomers race to study interstellar interloper
items.description: Phalanx of instruments scrutinize 3I/ATLAS for clues about planet formation elsewhere in the galaxy

items.title: U.S. abandons hunt for signal of cosmic inflation
items.description: Now-canceled CMB-S4 project would have searched the afterglow of the Big Bang for signs of cosmic exponential growth spurt
